alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong storm will impact portions of northeastern Surry and southwestern Patrick Counties through 1215 PM EST... At 1147 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodville, or near Ararat, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ararat... and Woodville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for north central North Carolina...and south central Virginia.
